dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Ulmus{/it} of the family Ulmaceae, the elm family) of usually large deciduous north temperate-zone trees with alternate stipulate leaves and fruit that is a samara

et: Middle English, from Old English; akin to Old High German {it}elme{/it} elm, Latin {it}ulmus{/it}
shortdef: any of a genus (Ulmus of the family Ulmaceae, the elm family) of usually large deciduous north temperate-zone trees with alternate stipulate leaves and fruit that is a samara

dt: {bc}a large elm ({it}Ulmus americana{/it}) of eastern and central North America that has gradually spreading branches and pendulous branchlets

shortdef: a large elm (Ulmus americana) of eastern and central North America that has gradually spreading branches and pendulous branchlets

dt: {bc}a large-leaved elm ({it}Ulmus rubra{/it} synonym {it}U. fulva{/it}) of eastern and central North America that has hard wood and fragrant mucilaginous inner bark

shortdef: a large-leaved elm (Ulmus rubra synonym U. fulva) of eastern and central North America that has hard wood and fragrant mucilaginous inner bark; also : the bark

dt: {bc}an elm ({it}Ulmus alata{/it}) of the U.S. having twigs with prominent corky projections

shortdef: an elm (Ulmus alata) of the U.S. having twigs with prominent corky projections —called also wahoo
